stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the whole session inside Blender and RM2K shaping the late-game overworld. The main task is to stop players from reaching Parts 13–15 immediately after Bowser 2. While modelling he designs several new overworld events (Yappy-block gate, bone-dragon buddy, Boobla infestation) and a secret windmill entrance, sketches the volcano/beach land-mass and discusses a map-unrolling pause menu and beta-testing logistics.

development_findings.summary: Players can currently walk straight from Part 10 to Parts 11–15; Kaze will physically block Parts 13 & 15 until a new overworld event is cleared.
development_findings.quote: Once you unlock part 10, you can go to part 11, part 12, part 13, 14, and 15. That is a bit much. I want to lock part 13 and 15 away.

development_findings.summary: New pause menu will show a full world map that unrolls like a parchment when the player presses start.
development_findings.quote: When you open the pause menu, an animation of this type of map unrolling happens.

development_findings.summary: He wants a small Discord pool of play-testers who receive builds, record full play-throughs, and return uncut footage for design feedback; focus is on player behaviour, not bug-hunting.
development_findings.quote: What I need is a reliable way to just find people that are willing to play my game for me … I look at the entire uncut footage.

development_findings.summary: Secret back entrance: an underground bunny burrow from Part 3 into Course 1’s windmill; contains a blue-coin switch and lots of coins, purely optional and discoverable late-game.

Bone Dragon event in the volcano: a huge skeleton head attacks until the player punches a rotten tooth (cavity). He then becomes friendly, lifts Mario to the rising-lava side-level, and may award a star if given a (yet-unspecified) crafted gold tooth.
development_findings.quote: He’s pissed because of a cavity … you go up to his teeth and punch it and as soon as you do that his eyes change to friendly and he’s like, ‘Oh my God, thank you’.

development_findings.summary: Pandora’s Box event above Course 5: opening it releases Booblas that haunt the area; destroying all of them grants a star.
development_findings.quote: If you open it Booblas burst out and haunt the area – destroy all the Booblas for a star.

development_findings.summary: Yappy-Block gate concept: two giant message blocks rhyme-insult the player and physically block the beach. After a Kamek overworld boss fight they apologise and slide aside, unlocking Part 13.
development_findings.quote: Approaching one of them should move both of them … after you beat Kamek they have a friendly face and say ‘I’m so sorry for the things I’ve said’.

development_findings.summary: Kamek fight is still undefined (possibly spawning sharks); beating her will also undo other ‘enchanted’ objects around the island.
World is being built as a seamless looping island; pathways serve as load-boundaries so no visible loading zones occur.
development_findings.quote: Everything’s connected, there’s no loading zones – you just go from thing to thing.

development_findings.summary: Train system: Tracks from Part 1 station to Grand Sand Badland (Course 12) and volcanic region; acts as fast travel and geographic clue tying the island loop together.
NTSC build first; PAL conversion considered later once tools exist.
development_findings.quote: Right now only NTSC is being worked on – porting to PAL later shouldn’t be difficult.

context_findings.summary: Kaze lives in Nova Scotia, Canada (moved 2021) and dislikes working in offices; prefers solitary workflow.
context_findings.quote: Yes, I live in Canada – I moved to Canada in 2021 … When I have people around me for too long, I get extremely tilted.

context_findings.summary: He values open-world design where obstacles feel organic, not invisible walls.
context_findings.quote: I want the player to look at something and be like ‘man, I could just jump over this’ – barriers should feel genuine.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: delights in subverting expectations by turning apparent bosses into friends (bone dragon) and adding secrets that serve no functional purpose beyond wonder.
context_findings.quote: Isn’t it way funnier and more impactful if you don’t get the boss battle you expect?

context_findings.summary: Expresses mild frustration when Blender bugs appear and when gating problem proves ‘cursed’, but iterates by shifting tasks until inspiration strikes.
Financial/time view: sees U.S. lower taxes as possibly outweighing healthcare costs; mentions being commissioned to make Drag Wars.
context_findings.quote: Someone paid me to make the whole thing.

biobak.summary: Suggested coin-economy considerations (farming vs optional purchases) and participated in secret-entrance brainstorming.

key_stories.title: The Bone Dragon with a Toothache
key_stories.summary: Kaze conceives a massive skeleton dragon head in the volcano area that first attacks Mario. The twist: it’s just cranky from a rotten tooth. Punching the tooth calms him, making him an elevator to a secret rising-lava level and possibly rewarding a star via a gold-tooth side quest.
key_stories.challenge: Create a memorable overworld gate that looks like a boss but fits the game’s ‘friendly creature’ tone.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed various ailments (splinter, back pain) before settling on a cavity; mapped out interactions and visual scale inside Blender.
key_stories.outcome: Note written to implement event; still deciding coin cost and smith NPC for gold tooth.
key_stories.key_quote: I literally just want to befriend the bone dragon.

key_stories.title: Talking Blocks Turned Bullies
key_stories.summary: Two giant ‘Yappy’ message blocks block the path to Part 13, taunting the player with rhymes. They’re under Kamek’s spell. Defeating Kamek reverts them, clearing the beach path.
key_stories.challenge: Need an in-universe barrier that feels organic, not an arbitrary wall.
key_stories.process: Rejected hide-and-seek and forklift ideas; settled on enchanted insulting blocks plus an overworld Kamek boss fight.
key_stories.outcome: Design notes finalized; fight mechanics TBD.
key_stories.key_quote: Roses are red, violets are blue… they’d just insult you and won’t let you through.

key_stories.title: Secret Windmill Entrance
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants optional secrets that reward curiosity. He designs an underground bunny burrow leading into Course 1’s unreachable windmill, containing only blue coins.
key_stories.challenge: Provide a ‘does nothing’ secret that nevertheless excites explorers.
key_stories.process: Spontaneous brainstorming on stream; wrote detailed design note.
key_stories.outcome: Added to task list; will add muffled Bunny Brushwoods music and door exit.
key_stories.key_quote: Adding a secret back entrance here that does nothing is kind of cool.
